review: I don't use Hulu or any of those other internet TV options so the Chromecast did not initially interest me. The second I read an article about how it was upgraded to enable my cell phone to cast to it then I was sold. I also use Videostream to watch movies from my laptop and it works perfectly. If you don't have a smart TV and you are tired of hooking up the HDMI cord and running it from your laptop to your TV then it is time up upgrade to Chromecast. I have one in the man cave, the living room and the bedroom. I love it!
author: Terry D. Barnes

review: It's a relatively cheap item for its kind. It has limitations with apps, and the only ones available are Netflix, Youtube, Hulu, Crunchyroll, etc. You can also cast your screen on Google Chrome, but it does lag. It was easy to install and easy to use. We used it at first in the beginning a lot, but right now, it's just sitting there gathering dust.
